div.l: Iohn knew the wey hem nedith no gyde
And at the mylle the sakke a doune he lath
Alen spake fyrst all haile symon in faith
How fares thy fair doughter and thy wyf
Alen welcome qduod symkyn by my lyf
And Iohn also how now what do ȝe here
By god qᵈuod Iohn symond nede haith no pere
Hym byhoves serue hym self that hath no swayn
Or elles he is a fole as clerkes sayn
Oure manciple I hope he will be dede
Swa werkes hym ay the veyns of his hede
And therfore is I come and eke alen
To grynde oure corne and carye hit hame ageyn
I pray ȝow spede hus hethen that ȝe may
Hit shall be don̄ qᵈuod symkyn by my fay
What will ȝe done while that hit is in hande
But god ryght by the hoper will I stonde
Qduod Iohn and see how gates the corn̄ gas Inne
Ȝit saugh I neuer by my fader kynne
How that he hoper wagges til ⁊and fra
Alen̄ ansuerd Iohn wilt þow swa
Than will I be byneth be my croune
And see how gates the mele falles doune
In tille the trogh that shall be my desporte
Qᵈuod Iohn in fath I may be of youre sorte
I is als ille mylner as ar͗e ȝe
This myller smyled of her nycetye
And thoght all this is don̄ but for a while
Thei weyn that no man̄ may hem begile
But by my thryft ȝet shall I blere hir eye
For all her sleght in her philosophie
The more queynte crekes that thei make
